comments: The base 2i representation (quater-imaginary representation) of nonnegative integers is obtained by interleaving with zeros, cf. A212494.More precisely, a(n) is the number n written in base -4; numbers [which represent some nonnegative integer] in base -4 are 0, 1, 2, 3, 100, 101, 102, 103, 110, 111, 112, 113, 120, 121, 122, 123, 130, 131, 132, 133,... - _M. F. Hasler_, May 20 2012
references: D. E. Knuth, The Art of Computer Programming. Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1969, Vol. 2, p. 189.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
